title: It should be kept in mind that King Henry was excommunicated and (not deposed, but) suspended from kingship: Gregory put Henry on the same level as a bishop who was suspended (and not deposed) from episcopal functions. He was therefore entitled to refer to Henry as rex, until the latter was finally deposed in 1080. This point should always be borne in mind when considering the relations between Henry IV and Gregory VII in the intervening years, though frequently enough the point is missed, so
